anime.description: The manga`s story begins with a high school boy named Haru and his mother living overseas. His mother orders him to take care of and "civilize" his adoptive brother Ren, a wild young boy who dislikes talking with other people. While their relationship is adversarial at first, they grow closer as they begin to understand one another. Source: ANN

tag.name: shoujo
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shoujo, literally meaning "girl", refers to a female audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: shounen ai
tag.description: Shounen Ai means boys love, and thus explores what happens when two boys (or men) fall in love. This is not to be mistaken for http://anidb.net/t2723 [Yaoi] which is (or, at least, how this term is often used by the western audience) used in adult works. This is not; that means there is no graphical sex. The female version is http://anidb.net/t2782 [Shoujo Ai].

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: age difference romance
tag.description: A romance between individuals of significantly different ages is featured. Depending on how big the age gap is and on the society featured, that may be considered taboo. While the terms "lolicon" and "shotacon", often used in relation to anime and its fandom, are limited to a physical or erotic attraction to sexually precocious girls or boys respectively, this tag expands into platonic romances and other age ranges.

character.name: Asakura Ayumi
character.description: A businesswoman that likes to visit the host club Natsu works at.

character.name: Onodera Shigemitsu
character.description: The landlord. Upon introduction, he is talking to Ren about his son that had died 5 years prior to cancer.

character.name: Onodera Setsuko
character.description: She is the landlord`s daughter-in-law. Setsuko works in the local hospital as the headnurse.

character.name: Itou-sensei
character.description: P.E. teacher in the school Ren is attending.

character.name: Natsukawa Ai
character.description: A middle school student that is being tutored by Shima, a fact that Aki is not fond of. Her parents got divorced, and while she didn`t get along with her classmates, she is not attending school.

episode.title: young grass
Young Grass
Young Grass
episode.summary: Spring arrives, and Haru`s dream of living with his brothers finally comes true. They move into a house together, and with the help of his former coworker Ikuyoshi, Haru`s plans to open a cafe seem to be coming aslong well... when something gives Haru cause for concern: Ren is staying cooped up inside his room. Annoyed by Ren`s attitude, Aki tells him he`s a useless kid unable to do anything on his own. Later, when Ren visits the home of Onodera, their apartment`s landowner... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: white christmas
White Christmas
White Christmas
episode.summary: Brothers Aki and Shima are upset by the sudden appearance of a "fourth brother" in the Kaidou family, and Haru`s excessively affectionate attitude towards Ren makes Aki explode with rage. Meanwhile, Haru happens to witness a car accident in the city. Since then, Haru begins leaving Ren alone in the apartment. On top of that, while Ren is home alone, one of Haru`s customers from the host club forces her way into the apartment, and--?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: black eye
Black Eye
Black Eye
episode.summary: It`s been five years since that summer. Haru works as a host while saving money for his twin brothers` tuition. One day, Haru`s lawyer Mikiko invites him to her office where he is reunited with Ren. Three months before his parents passed away, they adopted Ren. Since he lost his memory after the accident, Haru is at a loss, but Ren still insists on living with him! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: forest green
Forest Green
Forest Green
episode.summary: Having come to Canada upon hearing the fake news that his biological mother Haruko is in critical condition, high school student Kaidou Haru meets a young boy named Ren. "You have a new brother. Take care of him." So instructed by his mother, Haru is forced to spend the summer with Ren. Every day is a battle with Ren, who refuses to listen to anybody. However, as Ren grows to like Haru little by little and Haru comes to adore Ren as well, they make a certain "promise"... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: blue sky
Blue Sky
Blue Sky
episode.summary: Haru`s cafe "WHITE FANG" begins flourishing immediately after it opens. Even Haru and Ren`s recently awkward relationship is getting back to normal. However, Aki is in a terrible mood. Shima has been spending all his time taking care of Natsukawa Ai, one of the students he tutors. Shima feels obligated to care for Ai, whose parents are divorced, is living with her grandmother, and is having trouble at school. When he even goes out to meet her late at night, Aki finally loses his temper--?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: white fang
White Fang
White Fang
episode.summary: The book Ren brought from Canada is one of Haru`s old favorites and a story about a lone gray wolf who meets a human he comes to recognize as his master. Already hating himself for making Ren say he`ll be "just a brother," Haru is dealt the final blow by Seika`s words. Meanwhile, Ren manages his school life with the help of his classmate Juuzen and Kondo Kiri, another student returned from abroad, but he collapses during a PE class... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: cloudy sky
Cloudy Sky
Cloudy Sky
episode.summary: While Haru and Ren are out at a nearby zoo, Aki calls Haru to let him know a woman calling herself "Kiyoka" has showed up at the house. Kiyoka is Haru`s high school classmate and the co-owner of the cafe they`re about to open. While discussing the plans and preparations for the store, Kiyoka mentions a certain woman to Haru and gives him her contact information. Meanwhile, when Kiyoka asks Ren what he likes about Haru... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: cherry blossom
Cherry Blossom
Cherry Blossom
episode.summary: Just when Ren begins attending school, he`s seen kissing Haru goodbye by his classmate Kurosaki Juzen. A curious Juzen asks Ren if Haru is his boyfriend, but... Meanwhile, unable to get used to the increasingly close relationship of Haru and Ren, Ikuyoshi asks Haru a certain question. However, when Haru half-jokingly responds that he`d never be interested in a kid with so little sex appeal, Ren overhears their conversation...?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: summer storm
Summer Storm
Summer Storm
episode.summary: The e-mail Ren sent prompts Haruko to come to Japan all the way from Switzerland. Eagerly looking forward to seeing Haruko again, Ren innocently bubblles with excitement. But believing Haruko may notice how his relationship with Ren has changed, Haru is unable to show genuine excitement for Haruko`s visit. When Haruko finally arrives at the Kaidou family home, Ren tries to tell her what he`s thinking, but... A storm named Haruko has suddenly arrived at the Kaidou family home! What will happen to the brothers` quiet life?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: rainy season
Rainy Season
Rainy Season
episode.summary: Haru suddenly awakens to the sound of rain in his room. Shaken by the sight of Ren in his dream, his breathing becomes erratic. Realizing the reason for his dream, the next morning Haru questions Ikuyoshi. Meanwhile, experiencing his first rainy season in Japan, the stress from not being able to jog due to the unfamiliar humidity and rain cause Ren to start feeling unwell. As a result, he gets a nosebleed while talking to Juuzen at school and is taken to the nurse`s office. However, the school nurse asks him an unbelievable question...?! Source: crunchyroll
